info.title: Azure Load Testing
info.description: These APIs allow end users to create, view and run load tests using Azure Load Test Service.

Oauth2.description: OAuth 2.0 Flow with Microsoft Entra ID.

put.summary:
Upload input file for a given test Id. File size can't be more than 50 MB.
Existing file with same name for the given test will be overwritten. File
should be provided in the request body as application/octet-stream.
put.description:
Upload input file for a given test Id. File size can't be more than 50 MB.
Existing file with same name for the given test will be overwritten. File
should be provided in the request body as application/octet-stream.

parameters.description:
Unique name for the load test, must contain only lower-case alphabetic,
numeric, underscore or hyphen characters.

parameters.description: Unique name for test file with file extension like : App.jmx

values.description: If the file is a JSON config file to define the requests for a URL test.

AppComponent.description: An Azure resource object (Refer azure generic resource model :https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/resources/resources/get-by-id#genericresource)

resourceName.description: Azure resource name, required while creating the app component.

resourceType.description: Azure resource type, required while creating the app component.

resourceGroup.description: Resource group name of the Azure resource

subscriptionId.description: Subscription Id of the Azure resource

AppComponentUpdate.description: An Azure resource object (Refer azure generic resource model :https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/rest/api/resources/resources/get-by-id#genericresource)

resourceName.description: Azure resource name, required while creating the app component.

resourceType.description: Azure resource type, required while creating the app component.

url.description: This is a SAS URI to an Azure Storage Container that contains the test run artifacts.

expireDateTime.description: Expiry time of the container (RFC 3339 literal format)

AutoStopCriteria.description: Auto stop criteria for a test. This will automatically stop a load test if the error percentage is high for a certain time window.

autoStopDisabled.description: Whether auto-stop should be disabled. The default value is false.

errorRate.description: Threshold percentage of errors on which test run should be automatically stopped. Allowed values are in range of 0.0-100.0

errorRateTimeWindowInSeconds.description: Time window during which the error percentage should be evaluated in seconds.

code.description: One of a server-defined set of error codes.

message.description: A human-readable representation of the error.

details.description: An array of details about specific errors that led to this reported error.

innererror.description: An object containing more specific information than the current object about the error.

Azure.Core.Foundations.InnerError.description: An object containing more specific information about the error. As per Azure REST API guidelines - https://aka.ms/AzureRestApiGuidelines#handling-errors.

code.description: One of a server-defined set of error codes.

Azure.Core.azureLocation.description: Represents an Azure geography region where supported resource providers live.

value.description: The value of the certificate for respective type

values.name: KeyVaultCertificateUri
values.description: If the certificate is stored in an Azure Key Vault.

CreatedByType.description: The type of the entity that created the test run. (E.x. User, ScheduleTrigger, etc).

values.name: User
values.description: Entity was created by a user.

values.name: ScheduledTrigger
values.description: Entity was created by a scheduled trigger.

DailyRecurrence.description: Recurrence model when frequency is set as Daily.

interval.description: The interval at which the recurrence should repeat. It signifies the number of days between each recurrence.

DailyRecurrenceCreateOrUpdate.description: Recurrence model when frequency is set as Daily.

interval.description: The interval at which the recurrence should repeat. It signifies the number of days between each recurrence.

DimensionFilter.description: Dimension name and values to filter

values.description: The dimension values. Maximum values can be 20.

nextLink.description: Link for the next set of values in case of paginated results, if applicable.

ErrorDetails.description: Error details if there is any failure in load test run

message.description: Error details in case test run was not successfully run.

values.name: JmxFile
values.description: If the file is a JMX script.

values.name: UserProperties
values.description: If the file is a user properties file.

values.name: AdditionalArtifacts
values.description: If the file is not among any of the other supported file types.

values.name: ZippedArtifacts
values.description: If the file is a compressed archive containing a collection of various artifacts or resources.

values.name: UrlTestConfig
values.description: If the file is a JSON config file to define the requests for a URL test.

values.name: TestScript
values.description: If the file is a test script.

Frequency.description: Frequency of recurrence for a trigger.

values.name: Cron
values.description: Recurrence defined by a cron expression.

values.name: Hourly
values.description: Recurrence defined on an hourly basis, as specified by HourlyRecurrence.

values.name: Daily
values.description: Recurrence defined on a daily basis, as specified by DailyRecurrence.

values.name: Weekly
values.description: Recurrence defined on a weekly basis, as specified by WeeklyRecurrence.

values.name: MonthlyByDays
values.description: Recurrence defined monthly on specific days, as specified by MonthlyRecurrenceByWeekDays.

values.name: MonthlyByDates
values.description: Recurrence defined monthly on specific dates, as specified by MonthlyRecurrenceByDates.

FunctionFlexConsumptionResourceConfigura.description: Resource configuration instance for a Flex Consumption based Azure Function App.

instanceMemoryMB.description: Memory size of the instance. Supported values are 2048, 4096.

httpConcurrency.description: HTTP Concurrency for the function app.

FunctionFlexConsumptionResourceConfigura.description: Resource configuration instance for a Flex Consumption based Azure Function App.

instanceMemoryMB.description: Memory size of the instance. Supported values are 2048, 4096.

httpConcurrency.description: HTTP Concurrency for the function app.

FunctionFlexConsumptionTargetResourceCon.description: Configurations for a Function App using Flex Consumption Plan.

configurations.description: A map of configurations for a Function app using Flex Consumption Plan.

FunctionFlexConsumptionTargetResourceCon.description: Configurations for a Function App using Flex Consumption Plan.

configurations.description: A map of configurations for a Function app using Flex Consumption Plan.

HourlyRecurrence.description: Recurrence model when frequency is set as Hourly.

interval.description: The interval at which the recurrence should repeat. It signifies the number of hours between each recurrence.

HourlyRecurrenceCreateOrUpdate.description: Recurrence model when frequency is set as Hourly.

interval.description: The interval at which the recurrence should repeat. It signifies the number of hours between each recurrence.

engineInstances.description: The number of engine instances to execute load test. Supported values are in range of 1-400. Required for creating a new test.

splitAllCSVs.description:
If false, Azure Load Testing copies and processes your input files unmodified
across all test engine instances. If true, Azure Load Testing splits the CSV
input data evenly across all engine instances. If you provide multiple CSV
files, each file will be split evenly.

quickStartTest.description:
If true, optionalLoadTestConfig is required and JMX script for the load test is
not required to upload.

regionalLoadTestConfig.description: Region distribution configuration for the load test.

MetricAvailability.description: Metric availability specifies the time grain (aggregation interval or frequency)

timeGrain.description:
The time grain specifies the aggregation interval for the metric. Expressed as
a duration 'PT1M', 'PT1H', etc.

namespace.description: The namespace the metric belongs to.

primaryAggregationType.description: The primary aggregation type value defining how to use the values for display.

supportedAggregationTypes.description: The collection of what all aggregation types are supported.

metricAvailabilities.description:
Metric availability specifies the time grain (aggregation interval or
frequency).

value.description: the values for the metric definitions.

MetricNamespace.description: Metric namespace class specifies the metadata for a metric namespace.

value.description: The values for the metric namespaces.

MetricRequestPayload.description: Filters to fetch the set of metric.

filters.description:
Get metrics for specific dimension values. Example: Metric contains dimension
like SamplerName, Error. To retrieve all the time series data where SamplerName
is equals to HTTPRequest1 or HTTPRequest2, the DimensionFilter value will be
{"SamplerName", ["HTTPRequest1", "HTTPRequest2"}

timestamp.description: The timestamp for the metric value in RFC 3339 format.

Metrics.description: The response to a metrics query.

value.description: The TimeSeriesElement items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

MonthlyRecurrenceByDates.description: Recurrence model when frequency is set as MonthlyByDates.

datesInMonth.description: Recurrence set to repeat on the specified dates of the month. Value of dates can be 1 to 31 and -1. -1 represents the last day of the month.

interval.description: The interval at which the recurrence should repeat. It signifies the number of months between each recurrence.

MonthlyRecurrenceByDatesCreateOrUpdate.description: Recurrence model when frequency is set as MonthlyByDates.

datesInMonth.description: Recurrence set to repeat on the specified dates of the month. Value of dates can be 1 to 31 and -1. -1 represents the last day of the month.

interval.description: The interval at which the recurrence should repeat. It signifies the number of months between each recurrence.

MonthlyRecurrenceByWeekDays.description: Recurrence model when frequency is set as MonthlyByDays .

weekDaysInMonth.description: Specific days of the week when the recurrence should repeat.

index.description: Index of the week in a month at which the recurrence should repeat. For example, if the index is '2', weekDay is 'Monday', interval is 3 and frequency is 'Month', the recurrence will run every second Monday of the month and repeat every 3 months. Value of index can be 1 to 5.

interval.description: The interval at which the recurrence should repeat. It signifies the number of months between each recurrence.

MonthlyRecurrenceByWeekDaysCreateOrUpdat.description: Recurrence model when frequency is set as MonthlyByDays .

weekDaysInMonth.description: Specific days of the week when the recurrence should repeat.

index.description: Index of the week in a month at which the recurrence should repeat. For example, if the index is '2', weekDay is 'Monday', interval is 3 and frequency is 'Month', the recurrence will run every second Monday of the month and repeat every 3 months. Value of index can be 1 to 5.

interval.description: The interval at which the recurrence should repeat. It signifies the number of months between each recurrence.

values.name: TestRunEnded
values.description: Test run ended event. This event would occur when a test run reaches terminal state.

values.name: TestRunStarted
values.description: Test run started event. This event would occur when a new test run is triggered.

values.name: TriggerCompleted
values.description: Trigger completed event. This event would occur when a trigger completes.

values.name: TriggerDisabled
values.description: Trigger disabled event. This event would occur when a trigger is disabled.

notificationRuleId.description: The unique identifier of the notification rule.

displayName.description: The name of the notification rule.

scope.description: The scope of the notification rule.

lastModifiedDateTime.description: The last Modified datetime(RFC 3339 literal format).

displayName.description: The name of the notification rule.

scope.description: The scope of the notification rule.

NotificationScopeType.description: Scope type of a notification rule.

endpointUrl.description: Test URL. Provide the complete HTTP URL. For example, https://contoso-app.azurewebsites.net/login

requestsPerSecond.description: Target throughput (requests per second). This may not be necessarily achieved. The actual throughput will be lower if the application is not capable of handling it.

maxResponseTimeInMs.description: Maximum response time in milliseconds of the API/endpoint.

values.name: ResponseTimeInMilliseconds
values.description: Pass fail criteria for response time metric in milliseconds.

values.name: Latency
values.description: Pass fail criteria for latency metric in milliseconds.

values.name: Error
values.description: Pass fail criteria for error metric.

values.name: Requests
values.description: Pass fail criteria for total requests.

values.name: RequestsPerSecond
values.description: Pass fail criteria for request per second.

value.description: The NotificationRule items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

values.name: Percentage
values.description: Criteria applies for given percentage value.

PassFailCriteria.description: Pass fail criteria for a test.

passFailMetrics.description: Map of id and pass fail metrics { id  : pass fail metrics }.

passFailServerMetrics.description: Map of id and pass fail server metrics { id  : pass fail metrics }.

clientMetric.description: The client metric on which the criteria should be applied.

aggregate.description:
The aggregation function to be applied on the client metric. Allowed functions
- percentage - for error metric , avg, percentiles like p50, p90, & so on, min,
max - for response_time_ms and latency metric, avg - for requests_per_sec,
count - for requests

requestName.description: Request name for which the Pass fail criteria has to be applied

value.description:
The value to compare with the client metric. Allowed values - error : [0.0 ,
100.0] unit- % , response_time_ms and latency : any integer value unit- ms.

action.description: Action taken after the threshold is met. Default is continue.

values.name: continue
values.description: Test will continue to run even if pass fail metric criteria metric gets failed.

values.name: stop
values.description: Test run will stop if pass fail criteria metric is not passed.

actualValue.description: The actual value of the client metric for the test run.

values.name: passed
values.description: Given pass fail criteria metric has passed.

values.name: undetermined
values.description: Given pass fail criteria metric couldn't determine.

values.name: failed
values.description: Given pass fail criteria metric has failed.

resourceId.description: The resource id of the resource emitting the metric.

value.description: The value to compare with the server metric.

action.description: Action taken after the threshold is met. Default is continue.

values.name: continue
values.description: Test will continue to run even if pass fail metric criteria metric gets failed.

values.name: stop
values.description: Test run will stop if pass fail criteria metric is not passed.

actualValue.description: The actual value of the server metric

PassFailTestResult.description: Test result based on pass/fail criteria.

values.name: ThroughputOptimized
values.description: The recommendation for this category optimizes the throughput/RPS (Requests per Second) of the app.

values.name: CostOptimized
values.description: The recommendation for this category optimizes the cost of the app.

recurrenceEnd.description: Recurrence end model. You can specify the end either by providing a numberOfOccurrences (which will end the recurrence after the specified number of occurrences) or by providing an endDateTime (which will end the recurrence after the specified date). If neither value is provided, the recurrence will continue until it is manually ended. However, if both values are provided, an error will be thrown.

Recurrence end model. You can specify the end either by providing a numberOfOccurrences (which will end the recurrence after the specified number of occurrences) or by providing an endDateTime (which will end the recurrence after the specified date). If neither value is provided, the recurrence will continue until it is manually ended. However, if both values are provided, an error will be thrown.

RecurrenceEnd.description: Recurrence end model. Either provide numberOfOccurrences if you want recurrence to end after a specified number of occurrences or provide endDate if you want recurrence to end after a specified end date. If both values are provided, a validation error will be thrown indicating that only one field should be provided. If neither value is provided, the recurrence will end when manually ended.

numberOfOccurrences.description: Number of occurrences after which the recurrence will end.

endDateTime.description: The date after which the recurrence will end. (RFC 3339 literal format)

RecurrenceStatus.description: Actual state of the recurrence for the trigger.

remainingOccurrences.description: The number of occurrences remaining for the trigger. Null if recurrence end has end date instead of number of occurrences.

nextScheduledDateTimes.description: The next three execution times of the trigger. (RFC 3339 literal format)

RecurrenceWithCron.description: Recurrence is set based on cron expression.

RecurrenceWithCronCreateOrUpdate.description: Recurrence is set based on cron expression.

RegionalConfiguration.description: Region distribution configuration for the load test.

engineInstances.description: The number of engine instances to execute load test in specified region. Supported values are in range of 1-400.

region.description:
Azure region name.
The region name should of format accepted by ARM, and should be a region supported by Azure Load Testing. For example, East US should be passed as "eastus".
The region name must match one of the strings in the "Name" column returned from running the "az account list-locations -o table" Azure CLI command.

values.name: ERRORS

TestProfile.title: Test Profile Model.
TestProfile.description: The Test Profile Model. A Test Profile resource enables you to set up a test profile which contains various configurations for a supported resource type and a load test to execute on that resource.

testProfileId.description: Unique identifier for the test profile, must contain only lower-case alphabetic, numeric, underscore or hyphen characters.

displayName.description: Display name of the test profile.

testId.description: Associated test ID for the test profile. This property is required for creating a Test Profile and it's not allowed to be updated.

targetResourceId.description: Target resource ID on which the test profile is created. This property is required for creating a Test Profile and it's not allowed to be updated.

targetResourceConfigurations.description: Configurations of the target resource on which testing would be done.

lastModifiedDateTime.description: The last Modified datetime(RFC 3339 literal format).

TestProfileCreateOrUpdate.title: Test Profile Model.
TestProfileCreateOrUpdate.description: The Test Profile Model. A Test Profile resource enables you to set up a test profile which contains various configurations for a supported resource type and a load test to execute on that resource.

displayName.description: Display name of the test profile.

testId.description: Associated test ID for the test profile. This property is required for creating a Test Profile and it's not allowed to be updated.

targetResourceId.description: Target resource ID on which the test profile is created. This property is required for creating a Test Profile and it's not allowed to be updated.

targetResourceConfigurations.description: Configurations of the target resource on which testing would be done.

TestProfileRun.title: Test Profile Run model.
TestProfileRun.description: The Test Profile Run Model. Test Profile Run resource enables you to instantiate an already created test profile and run load tests to get recommendations on the optimal configuration for the target resource.

testProfileRunId.description: Unique identifier for the test profile run, must contain only lower-case alphabetic, numeric, underscore or hyphen characters.

displayName.description: Display name for the test profile run.

testProfileId.description: Associated test profile ID for the test profile run. This is required to create a test profile run and can't be updated.

targetResourceId.description: Target resource ID on which the test profile run is created

targetResourceConfigurations.description: Configurations of the target resource on which the test profile ran.

errorDetails.description: Error details if there is any failure in test profile run. These errors are specific to the Test Profile Run.

startDateTime.description: The test profile run start DateTime(RFC 3339 literal format).

endDateTime.description: The test profile run end DateTime(RFC 3339 literal format).

durationInSeconds.description: Test profile run duration in seconds.

testRunDetails.description:
Details of the test runs ran as part of the test profile run.
Key is the testRunId of the corresponding testRun.

recommendations.description: Recommendations provided based on a successful test profile run.

lastModifiedDateTime.description: The last Modified datetime(RFC 3339 literal format).

TestProfileRunCreateOrUpdate.title: Test Profile Run model.
TestProfileRunCreateOrUpdate.description: The Test Profile Run Model. Test Profile Run resource enables you to instantiate an already created test profile and run load tests to get recommendations on the optimal configuration for the target resource.

displayName.description: Display name for the test profile run.

testProfileId.description: Associated test profile ID for the test profile run. This is required to create a test profile run and can't be updated.

TestProfileRunRecommendation.description: A recommendation object that provides a list of configuration that optimizes its category.

configurations.description: List of configurations IDs for which the recommendation is applicable. These are a subset of the provided target resource configurations.

values.name: Accepted
values.description: Test profile run request is accepted.

values.name: NotStarted
values.description: Test profile run is not yet started.

values.name: Executing
values.description: Test profile run has started executing.

values.name: Done
values.description: Test profile run has completed successfully.

values.name: Cancelling
values.description: Test profile run is being cancelled.

testRunId.description: Unique test run identifier for the load test run, must contain only lower-case alphabetic, numeric, underscore or hyphen characters.

passFailCriteria.description: Pass fail criteria for a test.

autoStopCriteria.description: Auto stop criteria for a test. This will automatically stop a load test if the error percentage is high for a certain time window.

secrets.description:
Secrets can be stored in an Azure Key Vault or any other secret store. If the
secret is stored in an Azure Key Vault, the value should be the secret
identifier and the type should be AKV_SECRET_URI. If the secret is stored
elsewhere, the secret value should be provided directly and the type should be
SECRET_VALUE.

environmentVariables.description: Environment variables which are defined as a set of <name,value> pairs.

errorDetails.description: Error details if there is any failure in load test run

testRunStatistics.description:
Test run statistics. Key is the sampler name and value is the set of statistics for performance metrics like response time, throughput, etc. from the load test run.
The sampler name is the same as the name mentioned in the test script.
Sampler name "Total" represents the aggregated statistics of all the samplers.

regionalStatistics.description:
Regional statistics. Key is the Azure region name and value is the test run statistics.
The region name should of format accepted by ARM, and should be a region supported by Azure Load Testing. For example, East US should be passed as "eastus".
The region name must match one of the strings in the "Name" column returned from running the "az account list-locations -o table" Azure CLI command.

testResult.description: Test result for pass/Fail criteria used during the test run.

virtualUsers.description: Number of virtual users, for which test has been run.

startDateTime.description: The test run start DateTime(RFC 3339 literal format).

endDateTime.description: The test run end DateTime(RFC 3339 literal format).

virtualUserHours.description: Virtual user hours consumed by the test run.

subnetId.description: Subnet ID on which the load test instances should run.

requestDataLevel.description: Request data collection level for test run

debugLogsEnabled.description: Enable or disable debug level logging. True if debug logs are enabled for the test run. False otherwise

publicIPDisabled.description: Inject load test engines without deploying public IP for outbound access

createdByType.description: The type of the entity that created the test run. (E.x. User, ScheduleTrigger, etc).

lastModifiedDateTime.description: The last Modified datetime(RFC 3339 literal format).

ListTestQueryParams.search.name: search

Prefix based, case sensitive search on searchable fields - displayName,
createdBy. For example, to search for a test, with display name is Login Test,
the search parameter can be Login.

OldTestRunIdQueryParam.name: oldTestRunId
OldTestRunIdQueryParam.description:
Existing test run identifier that should be rerun, if this is provided, the
test will run with the JMX file, configuration and app components from the
existing test run. You can override the configuration values for new test run
in the request body.

TestRunIdParam.name: testRunId
TestRunIdParam.description:
Unique name for the load test run, must contain only lower-case alphabetic,
numeric, underscore or hyphen characters.
